sn29.6:1.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn29.6:1.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why some spontaneously-born dragons keep the sabbath, having transformed their bodies?”
sn29.6:2.1: “Mendicant, it’s when some spontaneously-born dragons think:
sn29.6:2.2: ‘In the past we did both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn29.6:2.3: When the body broke up, after death, we were reborn in the company of the spontaneously-born dragons.
sn29.6:2.4: If today we do good things by body, speech, and mind, when the body breaks up, after death, we may be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn29.6:2.5: Come, let us do good things by way of body, speech, and mind.’
sn29.6:2.6: This is the cause, this is the reason why some spontaneously-born dragons keep the sabbath, having transformed their bodies.”
